title: Ticket #4242: starter should have an argument to specify slot id/name
description:
Currently, the Starter is told it's slot id/name when the STARTD passes the -a argument. But -a is a daemon core argument that means "append to log name". This overloading is hacky, and makes it impossible to change it so that we can append something more meaningful to the start log name, such as JobId.

So we want to add an argument to the Starter that we can use to pass it's slot id/name and change the STARTD to use that argument in addition to -a.

The new argument will be -slot <n> where n is the slot number, possibly -slot n.m where n is the partitionable slot number and m is the dynamic slot number.
